subject: Re: [junit] Junit suggestions
msgSnippet: ... Actually, your tests are working quite nicely here.  Listen to them.  There s telling you that the methods have some form of undesirable coupling.  Instead
messageBody:
Thomas SMETS wrote:

> Hi,
>
> I every now & then manage to create TestCase that have the following
> inconsistency :
> setUp () & tearDown () implicitely rely on action happening in the
> "test".
>
> This is due to the fact that I break the law of "small methods" but ... may
> be JUnit could call once setUp () & tearDown () before calling the first
> test ?
>

Actually, your tests are working quite nicely here. Listen to them. There's
telling you that the methods have some form of undesirable coupling. Instead
of trying to force a specific method sequence, see if you can eliminate the
dependency altogether.

Mike

--
